JobFullDesc: Job DescriptionAt Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.Boeing's Test and Evaluation Organization (BT&E) is seeking a Mid-Level Engineering Technical Specialist (Level 3) to join the team in El Segundo, California. This is a technical services support role. This team enables business partners to perform their production, test, and manufacturing processes to facilitate equipment needs. Position Responsibilities:Performs technical and administrative functions as a part of the Test Asset Management (TAM) operationsServes as primary customer interface in the TAM service centerAssists customers with selection of M&TE (Measurement and Test Equipment) and completion of test equipment reservations to meet customer schedule requirementsPerforms research from a variety of Site, Program & Enterprise requestersPerforms variety of test equipment database updates & maintenance functions, coordinates equipment delivery to internal and external sites, and coordinates calibration of equipment with MATES (metrology and test equipment services) Metrology functionWorks cooperatively with other TAM process performers around the Boeing enterprise to provide solutions to customer's special equipment needsCollects, analyzes and validates equipment utilization and lifecycle metrics and coordinates related actions along equipment lifecycleThis position is expected to be 100% onsite.  The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.***Note: This role may require some travel to other sites in Southern California on an as-needed basis.This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee. Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):Experience with metrologyExperience with equipment operationsPreferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):Associate’s degree or higherExperience with asset managementExperience with data systems and toolsExperience with equipment repair processesExperience with suppliersExperience and involvement with outside related Professional organization activities (e.g. MSC, NCSLI, ASQ, IEEE, ASTM, etc.)Typical Education/Experience:  Education/experience typically acquired through advanced education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 6 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g. Master+4 years' related work experience, 10 years' related work experience, etc.).Relocation:Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.Drug Free Workplace:Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.Shift Work Statement: This position is for 1st shiftQualifications
